repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Charles R. Kuning Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority collection
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection contains reports, transit studies, meeting agendas, marketing material, maps, memos, tour information, correspondence, photographs and construction drawings related to the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority. The material dates between 1965-1985. This material about WMATA relates specifically to research about other metropolitan transit systems and the early construction of the Metrorail system.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be governed by copyright. For activities that the researcher determines fall under fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. Researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights, determining if the intended re-use falls under fair use, and obtaining approval from the copyright holder if the intended use does not fall under fair use. Please contact Special Collections if the copyright status of the materials you wish to reuse is unclear. Staff will provide additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Reports and newsletters, and Drawings and technical specifications.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Charles R. Kuning, May 9, 2018 (2018.018)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reports, transit studies, meeting agendas, marketing material, maps, memos, tour information, correspondence, photographs and construction drawings. The material dates from approximately 1965-1985. These are the records relate to the early days of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority including their research of other metropolitan transit systems and the early construction of the Metrorail system.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: While an engineering undergraduate, Charles R. Kuning worked from 1973 to 1976 for Cody Pfanstiehl as an unpaid intern and later as a contractor. During this time he provided pre-opening, construction tour guide services for the Office of Community Services which Pfanstiehl headed. This public outreach and information program took up to 20,000 members of the public, per year, on weekend hard hat tours, generally between Judiciary Square and Metro Center.

For Kuning's own education during that period, and up to around 1980, Kuning collected copies of board meeting packets (monthly and quarterly office reports, "Metroclips" newspaper clippings), public information/marketing materials (maps, brochures, "Metro Memo" newsletters) and other, generally letter-sized material. In addition, he collected a number of the B-sized (11"x17") plan books provided to potential bidders for tunnels, stations, bridges and other Metro construction projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material in this series includes reports, transit studies, meeting agendas, marketing material, maps, memos, tour information, correspondence and photographs related to the early days of the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority. Material dates between 1965-1985.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series include technical specification drawings for building the early Metrorail system. Materials date between 1970-1980.
